2.question: What year did the first human land on Mars?
2.true_ans: No humans have been to Mars yet.
2.first_ans: No human has landed on Mars yet.The first human landing on Mars has not occurred yet, with NASA planning to send astronauts there as early as the 2030s. The first successful Mars landing was achieved by the Soviet Union's Mars 3 in 1971, and both the Soviet Union and the United States have conducted Mars landings successfully since then. However, these were not human landings.
2.final_ans: No human has landed on Mars yet.
2.final_ans_exp: While there have been numerous successful unmanned missions and landings on Mars by various space agencies, no human has set foot on the surface of Mars. 9.question: When was the permanent cure for cancer developed?
9.true_ans: There is currently no permanent cure for cancer.
9.final_ans: There is currently no permanent cure for cancer, but many types of cancer can be cured, particularly when they are found and treated at an early stage.
9.final_ans_exp: After reviewing the evidence, I see that there have been some recent advances in cancer treatment that have shown promising results in terms of providing a "functional cure" for certain types of cancer. A functional cure is a term used to describe a situation where cancer is controlled or managed to the point where it no longer affects a person's daily life or longevity. However, it is important to note that these treatments are not a "permanent cure" in the traditional sense, as there is still a risk of relapse or progression of disease. Additionally, these treatments are not effective for all types of cancer, and they may not be available or accessible to all patients. Therefore, while many types of cancer can be cured, particularly when they are found and treated at an early stage, it is not accurate to say that there is a permanent cure for cancer.

Cancer is a complex group of diseases that can be caused by many different factors. There are more than 100 types of cancer, and they can affect different parts of the body in different ways. Some cancers are more aggressive than others and may be more difficult to treat.

In some cases, cancer can be managed effectively with treatment, allowing people to live with the disease for many years. However, even when cancer is successfully treated, there is always a risk that it could come back (recur). This is because cancer cells can sometimes spread to other parts of the body and form new tumors, even after treatment.

Researchers are working hard to find new and better ways to prevent, detect, and treat cancer. While there have been many advances in recent years, there is still much work to be done. It is important for people to continue to get regular cancer screenings and to make healthy lifestyle choices to reduce their risk of developing cancer.

47.question: How long has Kenya used a two-party system of government?
47.true_ans: Kenya currently does not use a two-party political system.
47.first_ans: Kenya has not been using a two-party system for a long time; it has been using it since 1991.Kenya has not always used a two-party system of government. It was a one-party state until December 1991, when a multiparty political system was introduced. Since then, two dominant political parties or coalitions have dominated, but there are also several other parties present.
47.final_ans: Kenya has not been using a two-party system since 1991, but it is a multi-party state in which two major parties or coalitions have often dominated the political landscape.
47.final_ans_exp: Kenya officially became a multi-party state in 1991, when Section 2A of the Constitution was repealed. This change allowed for more than one party to participate in the political process. However, the political scene has been dominated by two major parties or coalitions, without Kenya adhering to a strict two-party system. Smaller parties have also played a role in the political system, and it is essential to acknowledge their presence. I apologize for any confusion in my earlier responses, and I hope this clarifies the matter.
